div.p: Yours of the 31. Dear Hattie of later date and your of 3d, 4, 5 & 6th of Jany. recd during the last week but I have not been able to answer them as I am at my desk from 8 in the forenoon to 4, PM and have not time to go to dinner and by that time I am too tired to write but will try to write you a short note in the week besides my usual Sunday one. Tell my Boy that Pa is not angry with him at all for breaking the Barometer and my darling you should not feel so bad about it and as for one of your precious linils being broken I had rather every thing in the house should be smashed up than that you should ever cut your finger - so that you and our dear ones are well and comfortable I dont care about much else. I have got the album and am waiting to have some pictures tat (which can be done here, to send them by express they will go early in the week and if the rim is not closed again with ice you will get them by next sunday. I hope you get the $150.00 sent by Express on 2 Jany before you were in

want of new coat th, I fear the state of this Run and roads made it long in reaching you. I have had 2 night shirts made as the old ones had given out entirely but they only cost me the making, 45/ each - the cloth was given me as also many other things in fact whatever I want I have so much power over the Merchants that they offer me every thing so as to keep in my good graces. I hope that the entine cold has ceased with you as it has here - tho all the ice has not melted and Jan 15 days it froze every night infact I felt colder than I ever did before the ice in my water bucket in bed room did not thaw for 12 days. I send you a photograph of myself and one of Old Abe in a $10 bill. I shall have to close the mail hour being near and will try and write you with the albums in a day or two Kiss all and tell all to kiss you for me.
